definition: to lose/to transport/to donate/to enter (a password)

sentences.english: There are difficulties, but being defeatist can't help.
sentences.chinese: 困难总会有，但是认输气馁却于事无补。

sentences.english: Let the heaven know my gameness.
Afterwards, they have to admit defeat and make an unserious self-criticism.
sentences.chinese: 随后就是认输，做一点自我批评。

sentences.english: 1970 – Biafra capitulates, ending the Nigerian civil war.
sentences.chinese: 1970年的今天，比夫拉认输，尼日利亚内战结束。

sentences.english: Fu strong woman will admit defeat, but will not admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 乀坚强的女人会认输，但不会服输。

sentences.english: Everyone has to bow before the selfless time.
sentences.chinese: 在大公无私的时间前面，谁也不能不低头认输。

sentences.english: The project was ridiculous. Time to admit defeat.
sentences.chinese: 看来我的计划不切实际，是认输的时候了。

sentences.english: Yet perhaps it is too early for the English-speaking democracies to throw in the towel.
sentences.chinese: 然而，或许以英语为母语的民主国家认输还言之过早。

sentences.english: Claud quickened up, a man wouldn't give the battle.
sentences.chinese: 克劳德加快了速度，男子汉是不会认输的。

sentences.english: I stood aside, so I hauled down my colours.
sentences.chinese: 我退出竞选，我认输投降。

sentences.english: Never accept failure, no matter how offten it visits you. Keep on going. never give up. Never.
sentences.chinese: 即使再多失败也不能认输，坚持不懈，永不放弃。

sentences.english: They had to quit when they became aware of the fact that they could not win the game.
sentences.chinese: 他们在觉察到不可能打赢这场比赛时，只好认输。

sentences.english: Do not think for a minute that power concedes.
sentences.chinese: 一时一刻都不要以为执政党认输了。

sentences.english: With that said, companies cannot afford to throw up their hands and give up in the face of unpredictably.
sentences.chinese: 因此，公司不能在无法预知的事态前就认输甚至放弃。

sentences.english: Later they admit defeat and do a little self-criticism.
sentences.chinese: 随后就是认输，做一点自我批评。

sentences.english: I give up. Tell me the answer.
sentences.chinese: 我认输了，告诉我答案吧。

definition: to concede/to admit defeat/to admit sth is wrong after insisting it is right
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
lit. if you agree to bet you must accept to lose/fig. you bet, you pay
to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
to take defeat with bad grace/to be a sore loser/cannot afford to lose
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to move aside/to get out of the way/to back down/to concede
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
lit. start off leniently (idiom); please do not be too strict with me/Do not judge me too harshly./Look favorably on my humble efforts.
to accept misfortunes as decreed by fate/to be resigned to sth
not to fight back/to take it lying down/to show weakness/to show one's softer side
